intro: Ilysanthes antipoda, commonly known as the Antarctic buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the extreme environments of Antarctica. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow petals and simple, palmate leaves. The plant thrives in the cold, dry conditions of the continent, often growing in rocky soil or on bare ground. Its short growing season is typically limited to the summer months when temperatures rise slightly. Ilysanthes antipoda plays a minor but ecologically significant role in the sparse flora of Antarctica.
